author: Judith H. Dobrzynski
title: A Renaissance Artist Cloaked in Mystery
text:
Washington
Just as the National Gallery of Art was about to close its widely heralded “Vermeer and the Masters of Genre Painting” in its premier exhibition space, it was hanging the works of an earlier Northern European artist in a gallery off to the side. “Michel Sittow: Estonian Painter at the Courts of Renaissance Europe” lacks the branding power of Vermeer and is unlikely to draw his crowds—sadly. No-shows will be missing out on a superb exhibit of paintings by a powerful, somewhat mysterious painter who deserves to...
